answers.answer: Dear Deep Thinker,Before addressing the question of “stay or go” you’ll have to figure out how viable the situation is. It may be that your man is frightened to death of the responsibilities of parenthood and all that it involves, and has regressed to his worst, most adolescent state. So he may come out of it. Or he may be messed up, alcoholic or stuck in a pattern of childish irresponsibility that won’t go away for a long time, if ever, and that leads to the conclusion that he is a loser as a practical matter.I’d start by telling him that things aren’t working as is, and that you know it’s hard to adapt to grownup life, and here are some ways to go to get help with that (discussion of needs, parenting group, psych help, etc). If that doesn’t work, and he remains in denial and doesn’t change, I’d let him know that you won’t put up with it indefinitely. Note that he may change while denying that he’s doing so; men will do that. If that doesn’t work, and he gets nastier, or more controlling, slacks off more, or disappears more often, I’d begin to plan a separation. This would make increasing sense if his drinking really becomes DANGEROUS, to you and/or your child. If this happens, leave.In the process of all this, don’t forget to take a look at your own part in the problem. Maybe it’s nonexistent in your case, but sometimes a new mother can either behave weirdly toward her man, due to hormonal shifts, or just let the relationship lapse.In any case, you do indeed deserve more. So take these graded steps, test him out and educate at the same time, and see what happens. I don’t know how old either of you are, and if you’re both young, it may be that he just doesn’t know how to operate in the adult world. Women mature way earlier than men. Alternatively, he could have deep and enduring personality issues. We don’t know yet, and your job is to find out, over the medium term. It’s the only way to answer the “stay or go” question in a reliable way.Sincerely,Dr.P.

question: I've been in a relationship for almost two years. We have a 6 month old baby together. In the beginning, we had lots of fun together. I can still have fun with him but that's where things seem to stop short for me.  There are so many "little things" that I feel are wrong with our relationship. I'm done trying to communicate my feelings to him cause whenever I voice how I feel it becomes a me vs. him battle & ultimately, nothing changes between us. I'd have to say, that on average, I contemplate ending the relationship at least 2-3x a month.. if not 2-3x in a "bad" week.  My issues with him are things such as; He was coddled well into adulthood (up until the pregnancy) by his parents and this transcends into all areas of his life, he is not self-reliant, he does not 'think' for himself, he has unrealistic ideas about how adulthood should be, his mother is mean to me and he refuses to stand up to her cause that's "just the way she is", he doesn't help me take care of our responsiblities, he contirbution to our household is way less than 50% & so I contstantly feel busy trying to pick up the slack.. he drinks pretty much every day and often he gets so drunk he poses a hazard to himself and indirectly to me and/or our baby.. I feel so much resentment towards him for things like he's been a factor in driving a wedge between me and certain members of my family (he doesn't like them), My pregnancy was not easy on me or the baby, I had preeclampsia (hypertension) but looking back I feel like he made things worse for me, Even though I was pregnant, he wouldn't help me life something heavy, he never rubbed my feet or pulled out my chair, he didn't rely on me any less and I think he may have cheated while I was pregnant but I can't prove it..  There's so much more I could tell you..  But here's the thing..
title: Confused by my own feelings
